Comment: We should eliminate businesses funding presidential campaigns entirely. A business is not a person. A business cannot do anything that the *people* running that business don't want. That business, as an entity, has no right to anything beyond what the *people* extend to it. A business cannot sign a contract; the *people* representing it do. The business itself has no vote for the people on its board, and therefore should have no vote for a politician, monetarily or otherwise.   Then, tie the maximum annual contribution to the hourly minimum wage. 500x the hourly minimum wage makes it $3,650 annually, which is $150 more than it is currently. Want more? Raise the minimum wage. That's the gist of what I would introduce.
